reviews.review_msg: One of the hardest classes I've ever taken. Exams were graded so harshly, but the questions on the exams/quizzes were the exact same as the practice quizzes. There were no recorded lectures, only written modules posted on canvas that you had to memorize every detail of to succeed. If you want to do well, it will be extremely time consuming.

This was one of the worst formatted/created courses, I regret taking it. The exams/quizzes had different answers than what was said in the text, the questions are made to confuse you and aim for you to fail. I learned nothing, don't take it if you don't want to have a daily aneurysm. This course seemed like a fever dream considering how bad it was.

I honestly don't feel like I learned a single thing in this class. Exams were impossible and all based on memorizing tiny details. Prof was more focused on preventing people from cheating than teaching. Slow to return marks, and harsh grading when it eventually was. Unfortunate considering the material is interesting but the potential was wasted.

She displayed the content of the course really nicely in Canvas modules. The course is text-heavy (30% midterm, 35% final), and there are weekly quizzes and discussion posts. Be prepared to remember specific studies she mentions in the modules; the test require lots of detail for the short answer questions.

I'm currently enrolled in PSYC376 and I'm really enjoying the course so far. The exams are very clear-- ensure you do the self-practice tests and you'll know exactly what will be on the exams and weekly quizzes! The prof and TAs are accessible which is a relief. Very interesting content as well if you're going into forensic psyc!

Took PSYC 376 online with Tricia as the TA and honestly the course content was SUPER boring and repetitive.. unless ur really passionate about child forensic law. The way Deborah wrote the course content modules was kind of unclear and filled w errors too. But the exams are easy cuz all Qs are taken from Sample Quizzes online!

Without a doubt one of my favourite professors so far! She is extremely knowledgeable about the subject; to address an earlier comment, yes Trishia would clarify, but it was often about areas that she was more familiar with. She is super friendly and always willing to help.

She is clearly interested in the subject, but seems unknowledgeable. She was unable to answer about 80% of questions asked in class and the TA (Trishia Coburn) had to jump in and clarify all the time (which she did well!). Jamal gets confused by her own slides and notes and findings she presented were often contradictory with no explanation for why

Very disorganized teaching style! Class average on the first midterm was terrible . No notes posted, most people started bringing a laptop to class just to get all the notes down in time, but still had to continually ask her to go back and slow down. I was super interested in the topic but this prof ruined it for me.

Special topics course. Obviously very well versed with course material. No textbook but selection of articles which I appreciated. Used iclicker a lot. Definitely an academic- lectures were disections of published studies. It was a hard course but extremely interesting. She could be a bit scattered at times but was very intelligent and helpful.

Do not take this class. Your GPA will go down. The class average for the first exam was 56%, so that should tell you about their making scheme. They made this class harder than it actually is. Good luck.

Clearly, teaching is not one of Mansour's skills. However, she exhibits great talent at consistently making 5-6 HUGE/ confusing mistakes per class ("oops, I didn't mean that again", "oops, that's not the right term") + barely skimming through disorganized notes that she later tests on. PS- no posted notes, textbook, or recordings avail. Enjoy :)
Super nice guy - really interesting. Hard class, hard marker.  WebCT notes never complete. Lots of confusion about expectation, what he was looking for, what he wanted for answers etc...

Very interesting material but horrible prof. He's a researcher not a teacher. On Webct he does not post the complete powerpoint lecture outlines. Very stressful to keep up in lecture. Talks too much on slides we already have (half an hour a slide!) and as little as 15 seconds on ones we don't have! Good mark or not, it will be stressful.

Too much material in too little time... Prof seems to jump all over the place. Unorganized powerpoint slides. Extremely hard marking scheme and often limited time to write exams. Night before final WEBCT discussion board postings went up like wild-fire! Everyone confused!
This guy should not be a prof. Not good at it. Do not take a course with him unless you want to ruin your GPA.

Really terrible! He takes this course way too seriously. The exams are marked unfairly since he's so stringent about what makes a good answer. He covers topic really fast and the lecture notes he puts online are incomplete so you get lost when studying and lectures are not taped so you're screwed. 1/4 of the class was failing after midterms...ETC

Mandatory to attend lectures in order to pass the course. Exams are difficult, and you are not allotted enough time to complete them. Spends time in lecture emphasizing certain topics/themes/concepts that are not present on exams.
Most boring ever

Ryan is one of my fav profs at SFU. Class was mainly graded on two critical reviews and along with some quizzes and worksheets. He gives you guidance on how to critique the articles, and gives tips on how to write it. Super helpful, great lectures, and it made the papers easier to write. Make sure to do the readings and worksheets youl be fine!

Ryan is a great prof, super fun and attentive to students. Our class was based on weekly quizzes, four critical reviews from weekly readings and two major papers. He would guide us through the material and how to write and critically analyze articles, which was super helpful. 1000/10 recommend.
Awesome prof, awesome class.
One of the best profs I've had so far at SFU. He's super understanding and his criteria is always clear. Is very helpful if you approach him.

Ryan has been the best prof I've ever had! Lectures are genuinely engaging & interesting, easy to follow, assignments feel fair, & the course felt stress-free because there were no exams. I actually WANTED to attend lecture. Ryan is also a very accessible prof. He was very understanding when I had to email him about a missing assignment. Recommend!

Loved Ryan, he explains concepts very clearly & not only this but his lectures are interesting. The critical review assignments help prepare you for the big review at the end of the semester (worth 50%). I had Will Fox as a TA & honestly, I've never met a more understanding TA. Both of them are fantastic, understanding people. 10/10 would recommend

Lectures were dry and you learn more from the lower division level. Your grade was based on papers that had nothing to do with the actual subject of the class. If you are planning on taking this class be aware that on his grading scale a C+ is 67-72%

Dr. Fitz was amazing. I thoroughly enjoyed my class with him this semester. His lectures are engaging and super interesting. Class consists of 2 Critical Reviews and quizzes worth 10% of your grade (all due at the end and you get unlimited attempts). Will definitely be looking for future classes that he's teaching.

Dr. Fitzgerald was incredible, I would take one of his courses again in a heartbeat. He is well-informed, ready to lecture and makes it interesting/interactive. He showed us how to make a critical review of articles we read, and use that information to write our assignments. Do wish he provided more info on how to write a strong crit review.

This class was marked by 3 papers. The papers were really fun -- We got to analyze three academic journal articles and critique it. It really made us dig deeper into these topics on our own. Ryan's really nice and helpful. He has clear guidelines on his assignments. He's also a quick responder, which is very appreciated. I definitely recommend him!

I loved his class! He did his best to keep his students engaged, and was fairly accomodating when everything switched to online. Definitely does his best to help his students, and is a fair grader as well. Would 100% take a class with him again!

I absolutely loved his class! The course was delivered as non-synchronized mini-lectures and grades were based on 3 papers only. He does his best to make the content interesting and his grading is fair. The papers help you learn the content thoroughly. I recommend this course only if you are interested in the topic and prefer working alone.

I took this class during the pandemic so it was done remotely. He made his class 100% papers, and did a podcast style lecture + optional Netflix episodes with discussions. Maybe because we were so limited, but I felt that I didn't learn anything from this class as all we were graded by was our research papers. It was an interesting class but hard.
